const puppeteer = require('puppeteer');
const fs = require('fs');
const path = require('path');

async function testChatbot() {
  console.log('Starting chatbot functionality test...');
  
  const browser = await puppeteer.launch({
    headless: false, // Set to false to see the browser
    defaultViewport: { width: 1920, height: 1080 }
  });
  
  const page = await browser.newPage();
  
  // Set up console message logging
  page.on('console', msg => {
    if (msg.type() === 'error') {
      console.log('Console error:', msg.text());
    }
  });
  
  // Set up error logging
  page.on('pageerror', error => {
    console.log('Page error:', error.message);
  });
  
  try {
    // Navigate to the website
    console.log('Navigating to website...');
    await page.goto('https://civil-society-grants-database.netlify.app', {
      waitUntil: 'networkidle2',
      timeout: 30000
    });
    
    // Wait for page to fully load
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 3000));
    
    // Create screenshots directory
    const screenshotsDir = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'chatbot-test-screenshots');
    if (!fs.existsSync(screenshotsDir)) {
      fs.mkdirSync(screenshotsDir, { recursive: true });
    }
    
    // Take initial screenshot
    await page.screenshot({
      path: path.join(screenshotsDir, '01-homepage-with-chatbot.png'),
      fullPage: true
    });
    console.log('✓ Captured homepage screenshot');
    
    // Look for chatbot widget
    console.log('Looking for chatbot widget...');
    
    // Common selectors for chatbot widgets
    const chatbotSelectors = [
      '[data-testid="chat-widget"]',
      '.chat-widget',
      '.chatbot-widget',
      '.chat-button',
      '.chat-icon',
      'button[aria-label*="chat"]',
      'button[aria-label*="Chat"]',
      '[class*="chat-widget"]',
      '[class*="ChatWidget"]',
      '[id*="chat-widget"]',
      'iframe[title*="chat"]',
      'iframe[title*="Chat"]',
      '.fixed.bottom-4.right-4', // Common position for chat widgets
      '.fixed.bottom-5.right-5',
      'button.fixed'
    ];
    
    let chatbotFound = false;
    let chatbotElement = null;
    
    for (const selector of chatbotSelectors) {
      try {
        chatbotElement = await page.$(selector);
        if (chatbotElement) {
          console.log(`✓ Found chatbot with selector: ${selector}`);
          chatbotFound = true;
          break;
        }
      } catch (e) {
        // Continue to next selector
      }
    }
    
    if (!chatbotFound) {
      console.log('⚠️  Could not find chatbot widget with common selectors');
      
      // Try to find any fixed positioned elements
      const fixedElements = await page.evaluate(() => {
        const elements = document.querySelectorAll('*');
        const fixed = [];
        elements.forEach(el => {
          const style = window.getComputedStyle(el);
          if (style.position === 'fixed' && 
              (el.textContent.toLowerCase().includes('chat') || 
               el.className.toLowerCase().includes('chat') ||
               el.id.toLowerCase().includes('chat'))) {
            fixed.push({
              tag: el.tagName,
              class: el.className,
              id: el.id,
              text: el.textContent.substring(0, 50)
            });
          }
        });
        return fixed;
      });
      
      if (fixedElements.length > 0) {
        console.log('Found fixed elements that might be chatbot:', fixedElements);
      }
    }
    
    // Check for any JavaScript errors related to chat
    const jsErrors = await page.evaluate(() => {
      return window.__errors || [];
    });
    
    if (jsErrors.length > 0) {
      console.log('JavaScript errors found:', jsErrors);
    }
    
    // If chatbot found, try to interact with it
    if (chatbotFound && chatbotElement) {
      try {
        // Highlight the chatbot element
        await page.evaluate(el => {
          el.style.border = '3px solid red';
          el.style.boxShadow = '0 0 10px red';
        }, chatbotElement);
        
        // Take screenshot with highlighted chatbot
        await page.screenshot({
          path: path.join(screenshotsDir, '02-chatbot-button-highlighted.png')
        });
        console.log('✓ Captured chatbot button screenshot');
        
        // Click the chatbot
        await chatbotElement.click();
        console.log('✓ Clicked chatbot button');
        
        // Wait for chat interface to open
        await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));
        
        // Take screenshot of opened chat
        await page.screenshot({
          path: path.join(screenshotsDir, '03-chatbot-opened.png')
        });
        console.log('✓ Captured opened chat interface');
        
        // Look for chat input field
        const inputSelectors = [
          'input[type="text"]',
          'textarea',
          '[contenteditable="true"]',
          'input[placeholder*="message"]',
          'input[placeholder*="Message"]',
          'input[placeholder*="type"]',
          'input[placeholder*="Type"]'
        ];
        
        let inputFound = false;
        for (const selector of inputSelectors) {
          const input = await page.$(selector);
          if (input) {
            // Type test message
            await input.type('I need funding for women\'s rights projects in Ukraine');
            console.log('✓ Typed test message');
            inputFound = true;
            
            // Look for send button
            const sendButton = await page.$('button[type="submit"], button[aria-label*="send"], button[aria-label*="Send"], button:has-text("Send")');
            if (sendButton) {
              await sendButton.click();
              console.log('✓ Sent message');
            } else {
              // Try pressing Enter
              await page.keyboard.press('Enter');
              console.log('✓ Pressed Enter to send message');
            }
            
            break;
          }
        }
        
        if (!inputFound) {
          console.log('⚠️  Could not find chat input field');
        }
        
        // Wait for response
        await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 5000));
        
        // Take screenshot of conversation
        await page.screenshot({
          path: path.join(screenshotsDir, '04-chatbot-conversation.png')
        });
        console.log('✓ Captured conversation screenshot');
        
      } catch (interactionError) {
        console.log('Error interacting with chatbot:', interactionError.message);
      }
    }
    
    // Check network requests for chat-related endpoints
    const chatRequests = [];
    page.on('request', request => {
      const url = request.url();
      if (url.includes('chat') || url.includes('message') || url.includes('gemini')) {
        chatRequests.push({
          url: url,
          method: request.method(),
          headers: request.headers()
        });
      }
    });
    
    // Final analysis
    console.log('\n=== Chatbot Test Summary ===');
    console.log(`Chatbot widget found: ${chatbotFound ? 'Yes' : 'No'}`);
    console.log(`Chat requests made: ${chatRequests.length}`);
    console.log(`Screenshots saved to: ${screenshotsDir}`);
    
    // Save detailed report
    const report = {
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
      chatbotFound: chatbotFound,
      chatRequests: chatRequests,
      errors: jsErrors,
      screenshotsPath: screenshotsDir
    };
    
    fs.writeFileSync(
      path.join(screenshotsDir, 'chatbot-test-report.json'),
      JSON.stringify(report, null, 2)
    );
    
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Test failed:', error);
  } finally {
    await browser.close();
  }
}

// Run the test
testChatbot().catch(console.error);

const puppeteer = require('puppeteer');
const fs = require('fs');
const path = require('path');

async function testChatbotInteraction() {
  console.log('Testing chatbot interaction...');
  
  const browser = await puppeteer.launch({
    headless: false,
    defaultViewport: { width: 1920, height: 1080 }
  });
  
  const page = await browser.newPage();
  
  // Monitor network requests
  const requests = [];
  page.on('request', request => {
    requests.push({
      url: request.url(),
      method: request.method(),
      resourceType: request.resourceType()
    });
  });
  
  // Monitor console errors
  page.on('console', msg => {
    if (msg.type() === 'error') {
      console.log('Console error:', msg.text());
    }
  });
  
  try {
    await page.goto('https://civil-society-grants-database.netlify.app', {
      waitUntil: 'networkidle2',
      timeout: 30000
    });
    
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 3000));
    
    // Find and click chatbot
    const chatbot = await page.$('button[aria-label*="chat"]');
    if (!chatbot) {
      console.log('❌ Chatbot not found');
      return;
    }
    
    await chatbot.click();
    console.log('✓ Opened chatbot');
    
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));
    
    // Find input field and type message
    const input = await page.$('input[placeholder*="grants"], textarea, input[type="text"]');
    if (!input) {
      console.log('❌ Chat input field not found');
      return;
    }
    
    await input.type('I need funding for women\'s rights projects in Ukraine');
    console.log('✓ Typed message');
    
    // Try to send message
    try {
      // Look for send button
      const sendButton = await page.$('button[type="submit"]');
      if (sendButton) {
        await sendButton.click();
        console.log('✓ Clicked send button');
      } else {
        // Try pressing Enter
        await page.keyboard.press('Enter');
        console.log('✓ Pressed Enter to send');
      }
    } catch (e) {
      console.log('Could not send message:', e.message);
    }
    
    // Wait for response
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 8000));
    
    // Check for any API calls
    const chatRequests = requests.filter(req => 
      req.url.includes('chat') || 
      req.url.includes('gemini') || 
      req.url.includes('api') ||
      req.url.includes('netlify/functions')
    );
    
    console.log('\nAPI requests related to chat:');
    chatRequests.forEach(req => {
      console.log(`${req.method} ${req.url}`);
    });
    
    // Take final screenshot
    const screenshotsDir = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'chatbot-test-screenshots');
    await page.screenshot({
      path: path.join(screenshotsDir, '05-chatbot-interaction-test.png')
    });
    
    console.log('\n=== Interaction Test Summary ===');
    console.log(`Total requests: ${requests.length}`);
    console.log(`Chat-related requests: ${chatRequests.length}`);
    
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Interaction test failed:', error);
  } finally {
    await browser.close();
  }
}

testChatbotInteraction().catch(console.error);

const puppeteer = require('puppeteer');

async function testFixedSelector() {
  const browser = await puppeteer.launch({ 
    headless: false,
    args: ['--ignore-certificate-errors', '--ignore-ssl-errors']
  });
  const page = await browser.newPage();
  
  try {
    console.log('Testing fixed selector on local homepage...');
    await page.goto('http://localhost:3000', {
      waitUntil: 'networkidle2',
      timeout: 30000
    });
    
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 5000));
    
    // Test the new selector
    const featuredGrants = await page.evaluate(() => {
      // Look for the featured section specifically
      const headings = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('h2'));
      const featuredHeading = headings.find(h => h.textContent.includes('Featured'));
      let grants = [];
      
      if (featuredHeading) {
        const section = featuredHeading.closest('section');
        if (section) {
          const grantCards = section.querySelectorAll('.group.relative.rounded-3xl');
          grantCards.forEach(card => {
            const title = card.querySelector('h3')?.textContent || 'No title';
            const org = card.querySelector('p')?.textContent || 'No org';
            const deadline = card.querySelector('.text-red-600, .text-red-400')?.textContent || 
                            card.querySelector('.bg-red-100, .bg-red-900')?.textContent || 'No deadline';
            grants.push({ title, org, deadline });
          });
        }
      }
      
      return grants;
    });
    
    console.log('\n=== FIXED SELECTOR TEST ===');
    console.log(`Found ${featuredGrants.length} grant cards`);
    featuredGrants.forEach((grant, index) => {
      console.log(`${index + 1}. ${grant.title}`);
      console.log(`   Organization: ${grant.org}`);
      console.log(`   Deadline: ${grant.deadline}`);
    });
    
    if (featuredGrants.length > 0) {
      console.log('\n🎉 SUCCESS: Featured grants are now being detected!');
    } else {
      console.log('\n❌ STILL BROKEN: No featured grants detected');
    }
    
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error:', error);
  } finally {
    await browser.close();
  }
}

testFixedSelector().catch(console.error);

async function testGrantsAPI() {

    headless: false,
    args: ['--ignore-certificate-errors', '--ignore-ssl-errors']
  });
  const page = await browser.newPage();

    console.log('Testing grants API directly...');

    await page.goto('https://civil-society-grants-database.netlify.app', {
      waitUntil: 'networkidle2',
      timeout: 30000
    });
    
    // Make the API call and check the response
    const apiResponse = await page.evaluate(async () => {
      try {
        const response = await fetch('/.netlify/functions/grants');
        const data = await response.json();
        
        return {
          status: response.status,
          dataLength: data.length,
          firstGrantKeys: data.length > 0 ? Object.keys(data[0]) : [],
          firstGrant: data.length > 0 ? data[0] : null,
          sampleGrantNames: data.slice(0, 5).map(g => g.grant_name || g['Grant Name'] || 'NO NAME FIELD')
        };
      } catch (error) {
        return { error: error.message };
      }
    });
    
    console.log('\n=== GRANTS API RESPONSE ===');
    console.log(JSON.stringify(apiResponse, null, 2));
    
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error:', error);
  } finally {
    await browser.close();
  }
}

const puppeteer = require('puppeteer');

async function testLiveNow() {
  const browser = await puppeteer.launch({ 
    headless: false,
    args: ['--ignore-certificate-errors', '--ignore-ssl-errors']
  });
  const page = await browser.newPage();
  
  try {
    console.log('Testing live site now...');
    await page.goto('https://civil-society-grants-database.netlify.app', {
      waitUntil: 'networkidle2',
      timeout: 30000
    });
    
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 5000));
    
    // Test the featured grants with correct selector
    const verification = await page.evaluate(() => {
      // Featured grants check
      const headings = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('h2'));
      const featuredHeading = headings.find(h => h.textContent.includes('Featured'));
      let grants = [];
      
      if (featuredHeading) {
        const section = featuredHeading.closest('section');
        if (section) {
          const grantCards = section.querySelectorAll('.group.relative.rounded-3xl');
          grantCards.forEach(card => {
            const title = card.querySelector('h3')?.textContent || 'No title';
            const org = card.querySelector('p')?.textContent || 'No org';
            grants.push({ title: title.substring(0, 50), org: org.substring(0, 30) });
          });
        }
      }
      
      return {
        featuredGrants: grants,
        jsBundle: Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('script')).find(s => s.src?.includes('main.'))?.src || 'Not found'
      };
    });
    
    console.log('\n=== LIVE SITE TEST RESULTS ===');
    console.log(`JS Bundle: ${verification.jsBundle}`);
    console.log(`Featured Grants Found: ${verification.featuredGrants.length}`);
    
    verification.featuredGrants.forEach((grant, index) => {
      console.log(`${index + 1}. ${grant.title}`);
      console.log(`   Org: ${grant.org}`);
    });
    
    if (verification.featuredGrants.length > 0) {
      console.log('\n🎉 SUCCESS: Featured grants are now working on the live site!');
    } else {
      console.log('\n❌ STILL BROKEN: Featured grants not displaying on live site');
      console.log('   This may mean the deployment hasn\'t completed yet.');
    }
    
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error:', error);
  } finally {
    await browser.close();
  }
}

# File: scripts/test-mobile-homepage.js
# Size: 14121 bytes
# Modified: 2025-06-10T12:25:32.380Z
################################################################################

const puppeteer = require('puppeteer');
const fs = require('fs').promises;
const path = require('path');

// Define viewport configurations
const viewports = {
  'iPhone SE': { width: 375, height: 667 },
  'iPhone 12': { width: 390, height: 844 },
  'Android': { width: 360, height: 640 },
  'iPad': { width: 768, height: 1024 }
};

async function testMobileHomepage() {
  console.log('🚀 Starting mobile homepage testing...\n');
  
  const browser = await puppeteer.launch({
    headless: 'new',
    args: [
      '--no-sandbox', 
      '--disable-setuid-sandbox',
      '--disable-web-security',
      '--disable-features=VizDisplayCompositor',
      '--disable-dev-shm-usage'
    ]
  });

  const results = [];
  
  try {
    // Create screenshots directory
    const screenshotsDir = path.join(__dirname, '../mobile-test-screenshots');
    await fs.mkdir(screenshotsDir, { recursive: true });

    for (const [deviceName, viewport] of Object.entries(viewports)) {
      console.log(`📱 Testing ${deviceName} (${viewport.width}x${viewport.height})...`);
      
      const page = await browser.newPage();
      await page.setViewport(viewport);
      
      // Navigate to the homepage
      console.log(`  🌐 Navigating to homepage...`);
      try {
        await page.goto('https://civil-society-grants-database.netlify.app', {
          waitUntil: 'domcontentloaded',
          timeout: 60000
        });
        console.log(`  ✅ Page loaded successfully`);
      } catch (navError) {
        console.log(`  ⚠️  Navigation failed, trying alternative approach: ${navError.message}`);
        // Try a simpler approach
        await page.goto('https://civil-society-grants-database.netlify.app', {
          waitUntil: 'load',
          timeout: 30000
        });
      }

      // Wait for content to load
      await page.waitForSelector('body', { timeout: 10000 });
      
      // Take full page screenshot
      const screenshotPath = path.join(screenshotsDir, `${deviceName.replace(' ', '-').toLowerCase()}-full.png`);
      await page.screenshot({
        path: screenshotPath,
        fullPage: true
      });
      console.log(`  ✅ Screenshot saved: ${screenshotPath}`);

      // Analyze specific elements
      const analysis = {
        device: deviceName,
        viewport: viewport,
        issues: [],
        recommendations: []
      };

      // Check statistics cards
      console.log('  🔍 Checking statistics cards...');
      const statsCards = await page.evaluate(() => {
        const cards = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="stat"], [class*="metric"], [class*="card"]');
        const issues = [];
        
        cards.forEach((card, index) => {
          const rect = card.getBoundingClientRect();
          const styles = window.getComputedStyle(card);
          
          // Check if cards are properly stacked
          if (rect.width > window.innerWidth * 0.9) {
            issues.push(`Card ${index + 1} might be too wide (${rect.width}px)`);
          }
          
          // Check for overlapping
          if (rect.bottom < 0 || rect.top > window.innerHeight) {
            // Card is outside viewport, which is fine for scrolling
          } else if (rect.right > window.innerWidth) {
            issues.push(`Card ${index + 1} extends beyond viewport`);
          }
          
          // Check padding/margins
          const padding = styles.padding;
          const margin = styles.margin;
          if (padding === '0px' || margin === '0px') {
            issues.push(`Card ${index + 1} might lack proper spacing`);
          }
        });
        
        return issues;
      });
      
      if (statsCards.length > 0) {
        analysis.issues.push(...statsCards.map(issue => `Statistics: ${issue}`));
      }

      // Check featured grants section
      console.log('  🔍 Checking featured grants...');
      const grantsSection = await page.evaluate(() => {
        const issues = [];
        const grantsContainer = document.querySelector('[class*="grant"], [class*="featured"]');
        
        if (grantsContainer) {
          const rect = grantsContainer.getBoundingClientRect();
          const styles = window.getComputedStyle(grantsContainer);
          
          // Check readability
          const fontSize = parseFloat(styles.fontSize);
          if (fontSize < 14) {
            issues.push(`Font size might be too small (${fontSize}px)`);
          }
          
          // Check grant cards
          const grantCards = grantsContainer.querySelectorAll('[class*="card"], article');
          grantCards.forEach((card, index) => {
            const cardRect = card.getBoundingClientRect();
            if (cardRect.width < 250 && window.innerWidth > 360) {
              issues.push(`Grant card ${index + 1} might be too narrow`);
            }
          });
        }
        
        return issues;
      });
      
      if (grantsSection.length > 0) {
        analysis.issues.push(...grantsSection.map(issue => `Grants: ${issue}`));
      }

      // Check text readability
      console.log('  🔍 Checking text readability...');
      const textIssues = await page.evaluate(() => {
        const issues = [];
        const allText = document.querySelectorAll('p, h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, span, a');
        
        allText.forEach((element) => {
          const styles = window.getComputedStyle(element);
          const fontSize = parseFloat(styles.fontSize);
          const lineHeight = parseFloat(styles.lineHeight);
          
          // Check font size
          if (element.tagName.toLowerCase().startsWith('h') && fontSize < 16) {
            issues.push(`Heading might be too small (${fontSize}px)`);
          } else if (!element.tagName.toLowerCase().startsWith('h') && fontSize < 12) {
            issues.push(`Text might be too small (${fontSize}px)`);
          }
          
          // Check line height
          if (lineHeight / fontSize < 1.3 && element.textContent.length > 50) {
            issues.push(`Line height might be too tight for readability`);
          }
        });
        
        return [...new Set(issues)].slice(0, 5); // Limit to 5 unique issues
      });
      
      if (textIssues.length > 0) {
        analysis.issues.push(...textIssues.map(issue => `Text: ${issue}`));
      }

      // Check buttons and links
      console.log('  🔍 Checking buttons and links...');
      const buttonIssues = await page.evaluate(() => {
        const issues = [];
        const clickables = document.querySelectorAll('button, a, [role="button"]');
        
        clickables.forEach((element) => {
          const rect = element.getBoundingClientRect();
          const styles = window.getComputedStyle(element);
          
          // Check tap target size (minimum 44x44 for iOS, 48x48 for Android)
          if (rect.width > 0 && rect.height > 0) {
            if (rect.width < 44 || rect.height < 44) {
              issues.push(`Tap target too small (${Math.round(rect.width)}x${Math.round(rect.height)}px)`);
            }
          }
          
          // Check spacing between clickables
          const margin = parseFloat(styles.marginBottom) + parseFloat(styles.marginTop);
          if (margin < 8) {
            issues.push(`Insufficient spacing between interactive elements`);
          }
        });
        
        return [...new Set(issues)].slice(0, 5); // Limit to 5 unique issues
      });
      
      if (buttonIssues.length > 0) {
        analysis.issues.push(...buttonIssues.map(issue => `Interactive: ${issue}`));
      }

      // Check for horizontal scrolling
      console.log('  🔍 Checking for horizontal scroll...');
      const hasHorizontalScroll = await page.evaluate(() => {
        return document.documentElement.scrollWidth > window.innerWidth;
      });
      
      if (hasHorizontalScroll) {
        analysis.issues.push('Page has horizontal scrolling (content wider than viewport)');
      }

      // Check spacing and margins
      console.log('  🔍 Checking spacing and margins...');
      const spacingIssues = await page.evaluate(() => {
        const issues = [];
        const mainContent = document.querySelector('main, [role="main"], .container');
        
        if (mainContent) {
          const styles = window.getComputedStyle(mainContent);
          const paddingLeft = parseFloat(styles.paddingLeft);
          const paddingRight = parseFloat(styles.paddingRight);
          
          if (paddingLeft < 12 || paddingRight < 12) {
            issues.push(`Main content has insufficient horizontal padding (${paddingLeft}px / ${paddingRight}px)`);
          }
        }
        
        // Check sections
        const sections = document.querySelectorAll('section, [class*="section"]');
        sections.forEach((section, index) => {
          const styles = window.getComputedStyle(section);
          const marginBottom = parseFloat(styles.marginBottom);
          const paddingBottom = parseFloat(styles.paddingBottom);
          
          if (marginBottom + paddingBottom < 20) {
            issues.push(`Section ${index + 1} might have insufficient bottom spacing`);
          }
        });
        
        return issues;
      });
      
      if (spacingIssues.length > 0) {
        analysis.issues.push(...spacingIssues.map(issue => `Spacing: ${issue}`));
      }

      // Generate recommendations based on issues
      if (analysis.issues.length > 0) {
        console.log(`  ⚠️  Found ${analysis.issues.length} issues`);
        
        // Generate specific recommendations
        if (analysis.issues.some(issue => issue.includes('too small'))) {
          analysis.recommendations.push('Increase font sizes for better mobile readability (min 14px for body, 16px for headings)');
        }
        
        if (analysis.issues.some(issue => issue.includes('tap target'))) {
          analysis.recommendations.push('Increase button/link sizes to minimum 44x44px for better touch accessibility');
        }
        
        if (analysis.issues.some(issue => issue.includes('horizontal scroll'))) {
          analysis.recommendations.push('Add `overflow-x: hidden` to body or fix elements causing horizontal overflow');
        }
        
        if (analysis.issues.some(issue => issue.includes('spacing'))) {
          analysis.recommendations.push('Add proper padding (min 16px) and margins between sections for better visual hierarchy');
        }
        
        if (analysis.issues.some(issue => issue.includes('Statistics'))) {
          analysis.recommendations.push('Ensure statistics cards stack vertically on mobile with proper margins');
        }
      } else {
        console.log('  ✅ No major issues found');
      }

      results.push(analysis);
      await page.close();
    }

    // Generate detailed report
    console.log('\n📊 Generating detailed report...\n');
    
    let report = '# Mobile Homepage Test Report\n\n';
    report += `Test Date: ${new Date().toISOString()}\n\n`;
    report += '## Summary\n\n';
    
    const totalIssues = results.reduce((sum, r) => sum + r.issues.length, 0);
    report += `- Total issues found: ${totalIssues}\n`;
    report += `- Devices tested: ${results.length}\n\n`;
    
    report += '## Detailed Findings\n\n';
    
    for (const result of results) {
      report += `### ${result.device} (${result.viewport.width}x${result.viewport.height})\n\n`;
      
      if (result.issues.length === 0) {
        report += '✅ No issues found\n\n';
      } else {
        report += '#### Issues:\n';
        result.issues.forEach(issue => {
          report += `- ${issue}\n`;
        });
        report += '\n';
        
        if (result.recommendations.length > 0) {
          report += '#### Recommendations:\n';
          result.recommendations.forEach(rec => {
            report += `- ${rec}\n`;
          });
          report += '\n';
        }
      }
    }
    
    // Add CSS recommendations
    report += '## CSS Fixes Needed\n\n';
    report += '```css\n';
    report += '/* Mobile-first responsive improvements */\n';
    report += '@media (max-width: 768px) {\n';
    report += '  /* Ensure proper spacing */\n';
    report += '  .container, main {\n';
    report += '    padding-left: 16px;\n';
    report += '    padding-right: 16px;\n';
    report += '  }\n\n';
    report += '  /* Stack statistics cards */\n';
    report += '  .stats-container {\n';
    report += '    flex-direction: column;\n';
    report += '    gap: 16px;\n';
    report += '  }\n\n';
    report += '  /* Improve text readability */\n';
    report += '  body {\n';
    report += '    font-size: 16px;\n';
    report += '    line-height: 1.5;\n';
    report += '  }\n\n';
    report += '  /* Ensure touch-friendly buttons */\n';
    report += '  button, a.button, [role="button"] {\n';
    report += '    min-height: 44px;\n';
    report += '    min-width: 44px;\n';
    report += '    padding: 12px 16px;\n';
    report += '  }\n\n';
    report += '  /* Prevent horizontal scroll */\n';
    report += '  body {\n';
    report += '    overflow-x: hidden;\n';
    report += '  }\n\n';
    report += '  /* Card improvements */\n';
    report += '  .grant-card, .card {\n';
    report += '    width: 100%;\n';
    report += '    margin-bottom: 16px;\n';
    report += '  }\n';
    report += '}\n';
    report += '```\n';
    
    // Save report
    const reportPath = path.join(screenshotsDir, 'mobile-test-report.md');
    await fs.writeFile(reportPath, report);
    console.log(`📄 Report saved: ${reportPath}`);
    
    // Also log key findings to console
    console.log('\n🔍 Key Findings:\n');
    results.forEach(result => {
      if (result.issues.length > 0) {
        console.log(`${result.device}:`);
        result.issues.slice(0, 3).forEach(issue => {
          console.log(`  - ${issue}`);
        });
        console.log('');
      }
    });

  } catch (error) {
    console.error('❌ Error during testing:', error);
  } finally {
    await browser.close();
  }
}

// Run the test
testMobileHomepage().catch(console.error);

#!/usr/bin/env node

/**
 * Supabase Connection Test Script
 * 
 * Tests connectivity to Supabase and provides diagnostic information
 */

const { createClient } = require('@supabase/supabase-js');
const path = require('path');
const fs = require('fs');

// Load environment variables
require('dotenv').config({ path: path.join(__dirname, '../client/.env') });

class SupabaseConnectionTest {
  constructor() {
    this.results = {
      environment: {},
      connection: {},
      auth: {},
      data: {},
      fallback: {}
    };
  }

  async testEnvironmentVariables() {
    console.log('🔍 Testing Environment Variables...\n');
    
    const envVars = {
      'REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL': process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL,
      'REACT_APP_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY': process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY,
      'SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY': process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY,
      'SUPABASE_URL': process.env.SUPABASE_URL,
      'SUPABASE_ANON_KEY': process.env.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
    };

    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(envVars)) {
      if (value) {
        console.log(`✅ ${key}: Set (${value.substring(0, 20)}...)`);
        this.results.environment[key] = true;
      } else {
        console.log(`❌ ${key}: Not set`);
        this.results.environment[key] = false;
      }
    }
  }

  async testSupabaseConnection() {
    console.log('\n🔗 Testing Supabase Connection...\n');
    
    const supabaseUrl = process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL || process.env.SUPABASE_URL;
    const supabaseKey = process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY || process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY;
    
    if (!supabaseUrl || !supabaseKey) {
      console.log('❌ Missing Supabase credentials');
      this.results.connection.status = 'missing_credentials';
      return;
    }

    try {
      const supabase = createClient(supabaseUrl, supabaseKey);
      
      // Test basic connection by querying grants table
      const { data, error, status } = await supabase
        .from('grants')
        .select('count')
        .limit(1);
      
      if (error) {
        console.log(`❌ Connection failed: ${error.message}`);
        console.log(`   Status code: ${status}`);
        this.results.connection.status = 'failed';
        this.results.connection.error = error.message;
        this.results.connection.statusCode = status;
      } else {
        console.log('✅ Successfully connected to Supabase');
        this.results.connection.status = 'success';
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.log(`❌ Connection error: ${error.message}`);
      this.results.connection.status = 'error';
      this.results.connection.error = error.message;
    }
  }

  async testAuthentication() {
    console.log('\n🔐 Testing Authentication...\n');
    
    const supabaseUrl = process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL || process.env.SUPABASE_URL;
    const supabaseKey = process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY;
    
    if (!supabaseUrl || !supabaseKey) {
      console.log('❌ Missing service role key for auth test');
      this.results.auth.status = 'missing_credentials';
      return;
    }

    try {
      const supabase = createClient(supabaseUrl, supabaseKey);
      
      // Check if hardcoded admin users exist
      const testUsers = ['admin@admin.local', 'mattia@admin.local'];
      
      for (const email of testUsers) {
        const { data: users, error } = await supabase.auth.admin.listUsers();
        
        if (error) {
          console.log(`❌ Could not list users: ${error.message}`);
          this.results.auth.status = 'error';
          this.results.auth.error = error.message;
          break;
        }
        
        const userExists = users?.users?.some(u => u.email === email);
        if (userExists) {
          console.log(`✅ Found user: ${email}`);
          this.results.auth[email] = true;
        } else {
          console.log(`⚠️  User not found: ${email}`);
          this.results.auth[email] = false;
        }
      }
      
      // Test app_users table
      const { data: appUsers, error: appError } = await supabase
        .from('app_users')
        .select('*')
        .limit(5);
      
      if (appError) {
        console.log(`⚠️  Could not query app_users table: ${appError.message}`);
        this.results.auth.app_users_accessible = false;
      } else {
        console.log(`✅ Found ${appUsers?.length || 0} users in app_users table`);
        this.results.auth.app_users_accessible = true;
        this.results.auth.app_users_count = appUsers?.length || 0;
      }
      
    } catch (error) {
      console.log(`❌ Auth test error: ${error.message}`);
      this.results.auth.status = 'error';
      this.results.auth.error = error.message;
    }
  }

  async testDataAccess() {
    console.log('\n📊 Testing Data Access...\n');
    
    const supabaseUrl = process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL || process.env.SUPABASE_URL;
    const supabaseKey = process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY || process.env.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY;
    
    if (!supabaseUrl || !supabaseKey) {
      console.log('❌ Missing anonymous key for data test');
      this.results.data.status = 'missing_credentials';
      return;
    }

    try {
      const supabase = createClient(supabaseUrl, supabaseKey);
      
      // Test grants table (should be publicly readable)
      const { data: grants, error: grantsError, count } = await supabase
        .from('grants')
        .select('*', { count: 'exact' })
        .limit(5);
      
      if (grantsError) {
        console.log(`❌ Could not read grants: ${grantsError.message}`);
        this.results.data.grants_readable = false;
        this.results.data.grants_error = grantsError.message;
      } else {
        console.log(`✅ Grants table is readable (${count} total grants)`);
        this.results.data.grants_readable = true;
        this.results.data.grants_count = count;
        
        if (grants && grants.length > 0) {
          console.log(`   Sample grant: "${grants[0].name || grants[0].grant_name}"`);
        }
      }
      
      // Test blog posts table
      const { data: posts, error: postsError } = await supabase
        .from('blog_posts')
        .select('*')
        .eq('status', 'published')
        .limit(5);
      
      if (postsError) {
        console.log(`⚠️  Could not read blog posts: ${postsError.message}`);
        this.results.data.blog_posts_readable = false;
      } else {
        console.log(`✅ Blog posts readable (${posts?.length || 0} published posts)`);
        this.results.data.blog_posts_readable = true;
        this.results.data.blog_posts_count = posts?.length || 0;
      }
      
    } catch (error) {
      console.log(`❌ Data access error: ${error.message}`);
      this.results.data.status = 'error';
      this.results.data.error = error.message;
    }
  }

  async testFallbackData() {
    console.log('\n🔄 Testing Fallback Data...\n');
    
    const jsonPaths = [
      '/client/public/data/grants.json',
      '/client/public/data/grants_uk.json',
      '/client/public/data/filters.json',
      '/client/public/data/filters_uk.json'
    ];
    
    for (const jsonPath of jsonPaths) {
      const fullPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', jsonPath);
      
      if (fs.existsSync(fullPath)) {
        try {
          const data = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(fullPath, 'utf8'));
          const filename = path.basename(jsonPath);
          
          if (filename.startsWith('grants')) {
            console.log(`✅ ${filename}: ${data.length} grants`);
            this.results.fallback[filename] = {
              exists: true,
              count: data.length
            };
          } else {
            console.log(`✅ ${filename}: Found`);
            this.results.fallback[filename] = {
              exists: true
            };
          }
        } catch (error) {
          console.log(`❌ ${path.basename(jsonPath)}: Invalid JSON`);
          this.results.fallback[path.basename(jsonPath)] = {
            exists: true,
            valid: false
          };
        }
      } else {
        console.log(`❌ ${path.basename(jsonPath)}: Not found`);
        this.results.fallback[path.basename(jsonPath)] = {
          exists: false
        };
      }
    }
  }

  async generateReport() {
    console.log('\n📋 DIAGNOSTIC SUMMARY\n');
    console.log('=' * 50);
    
    // Environment check
    const envConfigured = Object.values(this.results.environment).filter(v => v).length;
    console.log(`\nEnvironment Variables: ${envConfigured}/5 configured`);
    
    // Connection status
    console.log(`\nSupabase Connection: ${this.results.connection.status || 'not tested'}`);
    
    // Auth status
    const authIssues = [];
    if (!this.results.auth['admin@admin.local']) authIssues.push('admin user not found');
    if (!this.results.auth.app_users_accessible) authIssues.push('app_users table not accessible');
    
    console.log(`\nAuthentication: ${authIssues.length === 0 ? '✅ OK' : `⚠️  Issues: ${authIssues.join(', ')}`}`);
    
    // Data access
    console.log(`\nData Access:`);
    console.log(`  - Grants: ${this.results.data.grants_readable ? `✅ ${this.results.data.grants_count} grants` : '❌ Not accessible'}`);
    console.log(`  - Blog Posts: ${this.results.data.blog_posts_readable ? `✅ ${this.results.data.blog_posts_count} posts` : '⚠️  Not accessible'}`);
    
    // Fallback data
    const fallbackFiles = Object.values(this.results.fallback).filter(v => v.exists).length;
    console.log(`\nFallback JSON Files: ${fallbackFiles}/4 available`);
    
    // Recommendations
    console.log('\n🔧 RECOMMENDATIONS:\n');
    
    if (this.results.connection.status !== 'success') {
      console.log('1. ❗ Supabase connection failed. Possible solutions:');
      console.log('   - Check if Supabase project is active');
      console.log('   - Verify environment variables are correct');
      console.log('   - Check Supabase dashboard for any issues');
      console.log('   - Consider using fallback JSON data temporarily');
    }
    
    if (!this.results.auth['admin@admin.local']) {
      console.log('\n2. ❗ Admin users not configured. Run:');
      console.log('   npm run setup:admin-users');
      console.log('   OR use hardcoded login: admin/admin123');
    }
    
    if (!this.results.data.grants_readable && fallbackFiles > 0) {
      console.log('\n3. ℹ️  Grants not readable from Supabase but fallback data available');
      console.log('   The app should still work using static JSON files');
    }
    
    console.log('\n🔐 FALLBACK LOGIN CREDENTIALS:');
    console.log('   Username: admin');
    console.log('   Password: admin123');
    console.log('   (or)');
    console.log('   Username: mattia');
    console.log('   Password: admin123');
    console.log('\n   These will work even if Supabase is down!');
  }

  async run() {
    console.log('🏥 Supabase Connection Diagnostic Tool\n');
    console.log('=' * 50);
    
    await this.testEnvironmentVariables();
    await this.testSupabaseConnection();
    await this.testAuthentication();
    await this.testDataAccess();
    await this.testFallbackData();
    await this.generateReport();
  }
}

// Run the diagnostic
if (require.main === module) {
  const tester = new SupabaseConnectionTest();
  tester.run().catch(error => {
    console.error('\n❌ Diagnostic failed:', error.message);
    process.exit(1);
  });
}

module.exports = SupabaseConnectionTest;

const { createClient } = require('@supabase/supabase-js');
const fs = require('fs');
const path = require('path');
require('dotenv').config();

// Initialize Supabase client
const supabase = createClient(
  process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL || process.env.SUPABASE_URL,
  process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY || process.env.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
);

/**
 * Maps Supabase grant fields to the static JSON format
 * @param {Object} grant - Grant object from Supabase
 * @returns {Object} Formatted grant for static JSON
 */
function formatGrantForJSON(grant) {
  return {
    id: grant.id,
    grant_name: grant.grant_name || '',
    funding_organization: grant.funding_organization || '',
    country_region: grant.country_region || '',
    eligibility_criteria: grant.eligibility_criteria || '',
    focus_areas: grant.focus_areas || '',
    grant_amount: grant.grant_amount || '',
    application_deadline: grant.application_deadline || '',
    duration: grant.duration || '',
    website_link: grant.website_link || '',
    status: grant.status || 'active',
    featured: grant.featured || false,
    view_count: grant.view_count || 0,
    created_at: grant.created_at || '',
    updated_at: grant.updated_at || '',
    detailed_description: grant.detailed_description || '',
    contact_email: grant.contact_email || null,
    contact_phone: grant.contact_phone || null,
    contact_person: grant.contact_person || null,
    application_procedure: grant.application_procedure || '',
    required_documents: grant.required_documents || '',
    additional_requirements: grant.additional_requirements || '',
    program_type: grant.program_type || '',
    target_beneficiaries: grant.target_beneficiaries || '',
    geographical_scope: grant.geographical_scope || '',
    language_requirements: grant.language_requirements || '',
    partnership_requirements: grant.partnership_requirements || false,
    renewable: grant.renewable || false,
    application_fee: grant.application_fee || null,
    reporting_requirements: grant.reporting_requirements || '',
    evaluation_criteria: grant.evaluation_criteria || '',
    keywords: grant.keywords || [],
    last_updated: grant.last_updated || grant.updated_at || '',
    // Ukrainian fields
    grant_name_uk: grant.grant_name_uk || grant.grant_name || '',
    funding_organization_uk: grant.funding_organization_uk || grant.funding_organization || '',
    country_region_uk: grant.country_region_uk || grant.country_region || '',
    eligibility_criteria_uk: grant.eligibility_criteria_uk || grant.eligibility_criteria || '',
    focus_areas_uk: grant.focus_areas_uk || grant.focus_areas || '',
    grant_amount_uk: grant.grant_amount_uk || grant.grant_amount || '',
    duration_uk: grant.duration_uk || grant.duration || '',
    application_procedure_uk: grant.application_procedure_uk || grant.application_procedure || '',
    detailed_description_uk: grant.detailed_description_uk || grant.detailed_description || '',
    target_beneficiaries_uk: grant.target_beneficiaries_uk || grant.target_beneficiaries || '',
    geographical_scope_uk: grant.geographical_scope_uk || grant.geographical_scope || '',
    required_documents_uk: grant.required_documents_uk || grant.required_documents || '',
    language_requirements_uk: grant.language_requirements_uk || grant.language_requirements || '',
    reporting_requirements_uk: grant.reporting_requirements_uk || grant.reporting_requirements || '',
    evaluation_criteria_uk: grant.evaluation_criteria_uk || grant.evaluation_criteria || '',
    additional_requirements_uk: grant.additional_requirements_uk || grant.additional_requirements || '',
    // Logo URL
    logo_url: grant.logo_url || null,
    application_url: grant.application_url || grant.website_link || ''
  };
}

/**
 * Maps grant to Ukrainian JSON format (simplified structure)
 * @param {Object} grant - Grant object from Supabase
 * @returns {Object} Formatted grant for Ukrainian static JSON
 */
function formatGrantForUkrainianJSON(grant) {
  return {
    "Grant Name": grant.grant_name_uk || grant.grant_name || '',
    "Funding Organization": grant.funding_organization_uk || grant.funding_organization || '',
    "Country/Region": grant.country_region_uk || grant.country_region || '',
    "Eligibility Criteria": grant.eligibility_criteria_uk || grant.eligibility_criteria || '',
    "Focus Areas": grant.focus_areas_uk || grant.focus_areas || '',
    "Grant Amount": grant.grant_amount_uk || grant.grant_amount || '',
    "Application Deadline": grant.application_deadline || '',
    "Duration": grant.duration_uk || grant.duration || '',
    "Website Link": grant.website_link || ''
  };
}

async function updateStaticGrants(dryRun = false) {
  console.log('🚀 Starting static grants JSON update...');
  if (dryRun) {
    console.log('🔍 DRY RUN MODE - No files will be modified');
  }
  console.log('📊 Fetching grants from Supabase database...');

  try {
    // Fetch all active grants from Supabase
    const { data: grants, error } = await supabase
      .from('grants')
      .select('*')
      .eq('status', 'active')
      .order('application_deadline', { ascending: true });

    if (error) {
      console.error('❌ Error fetching grants from Supabase:', error);
      process.exit(1);
    }

    console.log(`✅ Fetched ${grants.length} active grants from database`);

    // Format grants for English JSON
    const formattedGrants = grants.map(formatGrantForJSON);
    
    // Format grants for Ukrainian JSON
    const formattedGrantsUk = grants.map(formatGrantForUkrainianJSON);

    // Define file paths
    const grantsJsonPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'client', 'public', 'data', 'grants.json');
    const grantsUkJsonPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'client', 'public', 'data', 'grants_uk.json');

    // Backup existing files
    if (fs.existsSync(grantsJsonPath)) {
      const backupPath = grantsJsonPath.replace('.json', `.backup-${Date.now()}.json`);
      fs.copyFileSync(grantsJsonPath, backupPath);
      console.log(`📦 Created backup: ${path.basename(backupPath)}`);
    }

    if (fs.existsSync(grantsUkJsonPath)) {
      const backupPath = grantsUkJsonPath.replace('.json', `.backup-${Date.now()}.json`);
      fs.copyFileSync(grantsUkJsonPath, backupPath);
      console.log(`📦 Created backup: ${path.basename(backupPath)}`);
    }

    // Write updated grants to JSON files
    if (!dryRun) {
      fs.writeFileSync(grantsJsonPath, JSON.stringify(formattedGrants, null, 2), 'utf8');
      console.log(`✅ Updated grants.json with ${formattedGrants.length} grants`);

      fs.writeFileSync(grantsUkJsonPath, JSON.stringify(formattedGrantsUk, null, 2), 'utf8');
      console.log(`✅ Updated grants_uk.json with ${formattedGrantsUk.length} grants`);
    } else {
      console.log(`🔍 [DRY RUN] Would update grants.json with ${formattedGrants.length} grants`);
      console.log(`🔍 [DRY RUN] Would update grants_uk.json with ${formattedGrantsUk.length} grants`);
    }

    // Also update filters.json with current organizations, countries, and focus areas
    const organizations = [...new Set(grants.map(g => g.funding_organization).filter(Boolean))].sort();
    const countries = [...new Set(grants.map(g => g.country_region).filter(Boolean))].sort();
    const focusAreas = [...new Set(
      grants.flatMap(g => 
        g.focus_areas ? g.focus_areas.split(',').map(area => area.trim()) : []
      ).filter(Boolean)
    )].sort();

    const filters = {
      organizations,
      countries,
      focusAreas
    };

    const filtersJsonPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'client', 'public', 'data', 'filters.json');
    if (!dryRun) {
      fs.writeFileSync(filtersJsonPath, JSON.stringify(filters, null, 2), 'utf8');
      console.log(`✅ Updated filters.json`);
    } else {
      console.log(`🔍 [DRY RUN] Would update filters.json`);
    }

    // Update Ukrainian filters
    const organizationsUk = [...new Set(grants.map(g => g.funding_organization_uk || g.funding_organization).filter(Boolean))].sort();
    const countriesUk = [...new Set(grants.map(g => g.country_region_uk || g.country_region).filter(Boolean))].sort();
    const focusAreasUk = [...new Set(
      grants.flatMap(g => {
        const areas = g.focus_areas_uk || g.focus_areas || '';
        return areas.split(',').map(area => area.trim());
      }).filter(Boolean)
    )].sort();

    const filtersUk = {
      organizations: organizationsUk,
      countries: countriesUk,
      focusAreas: focusAreasUk
    };

    const filtersUkJsonPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'client', 'public', 'data', 'filters_uk.json');
    if (!dryRun) {
      fs.writeFileSync(filtersUkJsonPath, JSON.stringify(filtersUk, null, 2), 'utf8');
      console.log(`✅ Updated filters_uk.json`);
    } else {
      console.log(`🔍 [DRY RUN] Would update filters_uk.json`);
    }

    // Summary statistics
    console.log('\n📊 Update Summary:');
    console.log(`- Total active grants: ${grants.length}`);
    console.log(`- Organizations: ${organizations.length}`);
    console.log(`- Countries/Regions: ${countries.length}`);
    console.log(`- Focus Areas: ${focusAreas.length}`);
    
    // Show upcoming deadlines
    const upcomingDeadlines = grants
      .filter(g => g.application_deadline && new Date(g.application_deadline) > new Date())
      .slice(0, 5);
    
    if (upcomingDeadlines.length > 0) {
      console.log('\n📅 Next 5 upcoming deadlines:');
      upcomingDeadlines.forEach(g => {
        console.log(`  - ${g.grant_name}: ${g.application_deadline}`);
      });
    }

    console.log('\n✅ Static JSON files successfully updated!');
    console.log('📝 Files updated:');
    console.log('  - client/public/data/grants.json');
    console.log('  - client/public/data/grants_uk.json');
    console.log('  - client/public/data/filters.json');
    console.log('  - client/public/data/filters_uk.json');

  } catch (error) {
    console.error('❌ Error updating static grants:', error);
    process.exit(1);
  }
}

// Run the update if executed directly
if (require.main === module) {
  const isDryRun = process.argv.includes('--dry-run');
  updateStaticGrants(isDryRun);
}

module.exports = { updateStaticGrants };

const puppeteer = require('puppeteer');
const fs = require('fs');
const path = require('path');
const https = require('https');

// Configuration
const BASE_URL = 'https://civil-society-grants-database.netlify.app';
const SCREENSHOT_DIR = path.join(__dirname, '../deployment-verification-screenshots-enhanced');
const REPORT_FILE = path.join(__dirname, '../deployment-verification-report-enhanced.md');
const MAX_RETRIES = 5;
const RETRY_DELAY = 10000; // 10 seconds

// Create screenshot directory if it doesn't exist
if (!fs.existsSync(SCREENSHOT_DIR)) {
  fs.mkdirSync(SCREENSHOT_DIR, { recursive: true });
}

// Helper function to check Netlify deployment status
async function checkNetlifyDeploymentStatus() {
  return new Promise((resolve) => {
    https.get(BASE_URL, (res) => {
      console.log(`Deployment status code: ${res.statusCode}`);
      resolve({
        statusCode: res.statusCode,
        headers: res.headers
      });
    }).on('error', (err) => {
      console.error('Error checking deployment:', err.message);
      resolve({
        statusCode: 0,
        error: err.message
      });
    });
  });
}

// Helper function to wait and check for React app
async function waitForReactApp(page, timeout = 30000) {
  const startTime = Date.now();
  
  while (Date.now() - startTime < timeout) {
    try {
      // Check if React root exists
      const reactAppMounted = await page.evaluate(() => {
        const root = document.getElementById('root');
        const hasContent = root && root.children.length > 0;
        const hasLoadingSpinner = document.querySelector('.animate-spin, [class*="loading"], [class*="spinner"]');
        const reactDevTools = window.__REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__;
        
        return {
          rootExists: !!root,
          hasContent: hasContent,
          isLoading: !!hasLoadingSpinner,
          reactDetected: !!reactDevTools,
          bodyClasses: document.body.className,
          rootHTML: root ? root.innerHTML.substring(0, 200) : null
        };
      });
      
      console.log('React app state:', reactAppMounted);
      
      if (reactAppMounted.hasContent && !reactAppMounted.isLoading) {
        return true;
      }
      
      await page.waitForTimeout(1000);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error checking React app:', error.message);
    }
  }
  
  return false;
}

// Enhanced verification function
async function verifyDeploymentEnhanced() {
  console.log('🚀 Starting enhanced deployment verification...\n');
  
  const results = {
    timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
    siteUrl: BASE_URL,
    checks: [],
    networkRequests: [],
    consoleMessages: [],
    errors: [],
    warnings: [],
    screenshots: []
  };
  
  // First check deployment status
  console.log('📡 Checking deployment status...');
  const deploymentStatus = await checkNetlifyDeploymentStatus();
  results.deploymentStatus = deploymentStatus;
  
  if (deploymentStatus.statusCode !== 200) {
    console.error(`❌ Deployment returned status ${deploymentStatus.statusCode}`);
    if (deploymentStatus.error) {
      console.error(`Error: ${deploymentStatus.error}`);
    }
  }
  
  const browser = await puppeteer.launch({
    headless: 'new',
    args: ['--no-sandbox', '--disable-setuid-sandbox', '--disable-web-security']
  });
  
  try {
    const page = await browser.newPage();
    
    // Set viewport
    await page.setViewport({ width: 1280, height: 800 });
    
    // Enable request interception to track network activity
    await page.setRequestInterception(true);
    
    // Track network requests
    const networkRequests = [];
    page.on('request', request => {
      networkRequests.push({
        url: request.url(),
        method: request.method(),
        resourceType: request.resourceType()
      });
      request.continue();
    });
    
    page.on('response', response => {
      const request = networkRequests.find(r => r.url === response.url());
      if (request) {
        request.status = response.status();
        request.statusText = response.statusText();
        
        // Track failed requests
        if (response.status() >= 400) {
          results.errors.push({
            type: 'network',
            url: response.url(),
            status: response.status(),
            statusText: response.statusText()
          });
        }
      }
    });
    
    // Capture all console messages
    page.on('console', msg => {
      const messageObj = {
        type: msg.type(),
        text: msg.text(),
        location: msg.location()
      };
      
      results.consoleMessages.push(messageObj);
      
      if (msg.type() === 'error') {
        results.errors.push({
          type: 'console',
          message: msg.text()
        });
      }
    });
    
    // Capture page errors
    page.on('pageerror', error => {
      results.errors.push({
        type: 'page',
        message: error.message,
        stack: error.stack
      });
    });
    
    // 1. Navigate to homepage
    console.log('\n📄 Loading homepage...');
    try {
      const response = await page.goto(BASE_URL, { 
        waitUntil: 'domcontentloaded',
        timeout: 60000 
      });
      
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'Homepage accessible',
        passed: response.ok(),
        details: `Status: ${response.status()}`
      });
      
      // Wait for React app to mount
      console.log('⏳ Waiting for React app to mount...');
      const reactAppReady = await waitForReactApp(page, 30000);
      
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'React app mounted',
        passed: reactAppReady,
        details: reactAppReady ? 'React app loaded successfully' : 'React app failed to load'
      });
      
      // Get page state
      const pageState = await page.evaluate(() => {
        return {
          title: document.title,
          bodyClasses: document.body.className,
          hasRoot: !!document.getElementById('root'),
          rootChildren: document.getElementById('root')?.children.length || 0,
          scripts: Array.from(document.scripts).map(s => ({
            src: s.src,
            async: s.async,
            defer: s.defer
          })),
          links: Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('link')).map(l => ({
            href: l.href,
            rel: l.rel
          })),
          envVarsExposed: {
            hasSupabaseUrl: !!window.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL,
            hasSupabaseKey: !!window.REACT_APP_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
          }
        };
      });
      
      results.pageState = pageState;
      
      // Take screenshot
      const homepageScreenshot = path.join(SCREENSHOT_DIR, 'homepage-full.png');
      await page.screenshot({ path: homepageScreenshot, fullPage: true });
      results.screenshots.push('homepage-full.png');
      
      // Check for environment variables
      if (!pageState.envVarsExposed.hasSupabaseUrl || !pageState.envVarsExposed.hasSupabaseKey) {
        results.warnings.push('Supabase environment variables might not be configured');
      }
      
    } catch (error) {
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'Homepage accessible',
        passed: false,
        details: error.message
      });
      console.error('❌ Homepage load failed:', error.message);
    }
    
    // 2. Check for specific elements
    console.log('\n🔍 Checking for page elements...');
    try {
      const elementChecks = await page.evaluate(() => {
        const checks = {};
        
        // Check for header
        checks.header = !!document.querySelector('header, [role="banner"], nav');
        
        // Check for main content
        checks.mainContent = !!document.querySelector('main, [role="main"], .container');
        
        // Check for grants
        const grantElements = document.querySelectorAll(
          '[class*="grant"], [class*="Grant"], .card, .bg-white.rounded-lg'
        );
        checks.grantsFound = grantElements.length;
        
        // Check for loading indicators still present
        checks.loadingPresent = !!document.querySelector('.animate-spin, [class*="loading"]');
        
        // Check for error messages
        const errorMessages = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('*')).filter(el => {
          const text = el.textContent.toLowerCase();
          return text.includes('error') || text.includes('failed') || text.includes('unable to');
        });
        checks.errorMessages = errorMessages.map(el => el.textContent.trim()).slice(0, 5);
        
        // Check for API endpoints in network
        checks.apiCalls = performance.getEntriesByType('resource')
          .filter(entry => entry.name.includes('/api/') || entry.name.includes('supabase'))
          .map(entry => ({
            url: entry.name,
            duration: entry.duration,
            status: entry.responseStatus
          }));
        
        return checks;
      });
      
      results.elementChecks = elementChecks;
      
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'Header present',
        passed: elementChecks.header,
        details: elementChecks.header ? 'Header found' : 'No header element found'
      });
      
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'Main content present',
        passed: elementChecks.mainContent,
        details: elementChecks.mainContent ? 'Main content found' : 'No main content found'
      });
      
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'Grants displayed',
        passed: elementChecks.grantsFound > 0,
        details: `Found ${elementChecks.grantsFound} grant elements`
      });
      
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'No loading spinner stuck',
        passed: !elementChecks.loadingPresent,
        details: elementChecks.loadingPresent ? 'Loading spinner still present' : 'No loading spinner'
      });
      
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('❌ Element check failed:', error.message);
    }
    
    // 3. Check network requests
    console.log('\n🌐 Analyzing network requests...');
    results.networkRequests = networkRequests;
    
    const apiRequests = networkRequests.filter(r => 
      r.url.includes('/api/') || 
      r.url.includes('supabase') ||
      r.url.includes('/.netlify/functions/')
    );
    
    const failedRequests = networkRequests.filter(r => r.status >= 400);
    
    results.checks.push({
      name: 'API requests made',
      passed: apiRequests.length > 0,
      details: `${apiRequests.length} API requests found`
    });
    
    results.checks.push({
      name: 'No failed requests',
      passed: failedRequests.length === 0,
      details: failedRequests.length > 0 ? 
        `${failedRequests.length} failed requests: ${failedRequests.map(r => r.url).join(', ')}` :
        'All requests successful'
    });
    
    // 4. Check Netlify Functions
    console.log('\n⚡ Checking Netlify Functions...');
    try {
      const functionsResponse = await page.evaluate(async () => {
        try {
          const response = await fetch('/.netlify/functions/grants?limit=1');
          return {
            status: response.status,
            ok: response.ok,
            statusText: response.statusText
          };
        } catch (error) {
          return {
            error: error.message
          };
        }
      });
      
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'Netlify Functions accessible',
        passed: functionsResponse.ok === true,
        details: functionsResponse.error || `Status: ${functionsResponse.status}`
      });
      
    } catch (error) {
      results.checks.push({
        name: 'Netlify Functions accessible',
        passed: false,
        details: error.message
      });
    }
    
    // 5. Generate detailed report
    await generateEnhancedReport(results);
    
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('\n❌ Verification failed:', error.message);
    results.errors.push({
      type: 'fatal',
      message: error.message,
      stack: error.stack
    });
  } finally {
    await browser.close();
  }
}

// Generate enhanced report
async function generateEnhancedReport(results) {
  console.log('\n📝 Generating enhanced verification report...');
  
  const passedChecks = results.checks.filter(c => c.passed).length;
  const totalChecks = results.checks.length;
  const successRate = totalChecks > 0 ? (passedChecks / totalChecks * 100).toFixed(1) : 0;
  
  let report = `# Enhanced Deployment Verification Report

## Summary
- **Site URL**: ${results.siteUrl}
- **Verification Date**: ${new Date(results.timestamp).toLocaleString()}
- **Deployment Status**: ${results.deploymentStatus.statusCode || 'Unknown'}
- **Total Checks**: ${totalChecks}
- **Passed**: ${passedChecks} ✅
- **Failed**: ${totalChecks - passedChecks} ❌
- **Success Rate**: ${successRate}%

## Deployment Status
- **HTTP Status Code**: ${results.deploymentStatus.statusCode || 'N/A'}
- **Headers**: ${results.deploymentStatus.headers ? 'Present' : 'Not available'}
${results.deploymentStatus.error ? `- **Error**: ${results.deploymentStatus.error}` : ''}

## Verification Results

`;

  // Add check results
  results.checks.forEach(check => {
    const icon = check.passed ? '✅' : '❌';
    report += `### ${icon} ${check.name}\n`;
    report += `- ${check.details}\n\n`;
  });
  
  // Add page state information
  if (results.pageState) {
    report += `## Page State Analysis

- **Title**: ${results.pageState.title || 'No title'}
- **Has React Root**: ${results.pageState.hasRoot ? 'Yes' : 'No'}
- **Root Children**: ${results.pageState.rootChildren}
- **Body Classes**: ${results.pageState.bodyClasses || 'None'}
- **Scripts Loaded**: ${results.pageState.scripts.length}
- **Stylesheets**: ${results.pageState.links.filter(l => l.rel === 'stylesheet').length}

### Environment Variables
- **Supabase URL**: ${results.pageState.envVarsExposed.hasSupabaseUrl ? 'Configured' : 'Missing'}
- **Supabase Key**: ${results.pageState.envVarsExposed.hasSupabaseKey ? 'Configured' : 'Missing'}

`;
  }
  
  // Add network analysis
  report += `## Network Analysis

- **Total Requests**: ${results.networkRequests.length}
- **API Requests**: ${results.networkRequests.filter(r => r.url.includes('/api/') || r.url.includes('supabase')).length}
- **Failed Requests**: ${results.networkRequests.filter(r => r.status >= 400).length}

`;
  
  if (results.networkRequests.filter(r => r.status >= 400).length > 0) {
    report += `### Failed Requests\n\n`;
    results.networkRequests.filter(r => r.status >= 400).forEach(req => {
      report += `- ${req.method} ${req.url} - Status: ${req.status} ${req.statusText || ''}\n`;
    });
    report += '\n';
  }
  
  // Add console messages
  if (results.consoleMessages.length > 0) {
    report += `## Console Messages

`;
    const errorMessages = results.consoleMessages.filter(m => m.type === 'error');
    const warningMessages = results.consoleMessages.filter(m => m.type === 'warning');
    
    if (errorMessages.length > 0) {
      report += `### Errors (${errorMessages.length})\n\n`;
      errorMessages.forEach(msg => {
        report += `- ${msg.text}\n`;
      });
      report += '\n';
    }
    
    if (warningMessages.length > 0) {
      report += `### Warnings (${warningMessages.length})\n\n`;
      warningMessages.forEach(msg => {
        report += `- ${msg.text}\n`;
      });
      report += '\n';
    }
  }
  
  // Add element checks
  if (results.elementChecks) {
    report += `## Element Analysis

- **Header Found**: ${results.elementChecks.header ? 'Yes' : 'No'}
- **Main Content Found**: ${results.elementChecks.mainContent ? 'Yes' : 'No'}
- **Grants Found**: ${results.elementChecks.grantsFound}
- **Loading Spinner Present**: ${results.elementChecks.loadingPresent ? 'Yes' : 'No'}

`;
    
    if (results.elementChecks.errorMessages && results.elementChecks.errorMessages.length > 0) {
      report += `### Error Messages Found on Page\n\n`;
      results.elementChecks.errorMessages.forEach(msg => {
        report += `- ${msg}\n`;
      });
      report += '\n';
    }
  }
  
  // Add diagnosis and recommendations
  report += `## Diagnosis

`;
  
  if (results.deploymentStatus.statusCode !== 200) {
    report += `- **Critical**: Deployment is not returning HTTP 200 status\n`;
  }
  
  if (results.pageState && (!results.pageState.envVarsExposed.hasSupabaseUrl || !results.pageState.envVarsExposed.hasSupabaseKey)) {
    report += `- **Critical**: Supabase environment variables appear to be missing\n`;
  }
  
  if (results.elementChecks && results.elementChecks.loadingPresent) {
    report += `- **Issue**: Application is stuck in loading state\n`;
  }
  
  if (results.elementChecks && results.elementChecks.grantsFound === 0) {
    report += `- **Issue**: No grants are being displayed\n`;
  }
  
  if (results.networkRequests.filter(r => r.status >= 400).length > 0) {
    report += `- **Issue**: Multiple network requests are failing\n`;
  }
  
  report += `
## Recommendations

1. **Check Environment Variables**: Ensure all required environment variables are set in Netlify:
   - REACT_APP_SUPABASE_URL
   - REACT_APP_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
   - GOOGLE_GEMINI_API_KEY
   - SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY

2. **Review Build Logs**: Check Netlify build logs for any errors during deployment

3. **Verify API Routes**: Ensure Netlify Functions are properly deployed and accessible

4. **Check Browser Console**: The application appears to be stuck loading, check for JavaScript errors

5. **Database Connection**: Verify Supabase connection is working properly

## Screenshots

Screenshots saved to: \`${SCREENSHOT_DIR}\`

`;
  
  results.screenshots.forEach(screenshot => {
    report += `- ${screenshot}\n`;
  });
  
  // Save report
  fs.writeFileSync(REPORT_FILE, report);
  console.log(`\n✅ Enhanced report saved to: ${REPORT_FILE}`);
  console.log(`📸 Screenshots saved to: ${SCREENSHOT_DIR}`);
  
  // Print summary
  console.log('\n' + '='.repeat(50));
  if (successRate === 100) {
    console.log('🎉 DEPLOYMENT SUCCESSFUL - All checks passed!');
  } else if (successRate >= 80) {
    console.log('✅ DEPLOYMENT MOSTLY SUCCESSFUL - Minor issues detected');
  } else if (successRate >= 60) {
    console.log('⚠️ DEPLOYMENT PARTIALLY SUCCESSFUL - Several issues need attention');
  } else {
    console.log('❌ DEPLOYMENT FAILED - Critical issues detected');
  }
  console.log('='.repeat(50));
}

// Run enhanced verification
verifyDeploymentEnhanced().catch(error => {
  console.error('Fatal error:', error);
  process.exit(1);
});

# File: scripts/verify-deployment.js
